column1: The workplace is changing. However::: women are still vastly underrepresented in science::: technology::: engineering::: and math fields. The Women's Roundtable Summit provided an opportunity for women from across the state to join together and hear from some nationally recognized women about reversing this national trend. column3: So::: what is Clemson doing to change the predominantly male STEM departments they have? Besides a round table obviously.  I see ME has increased their female faculty by 400% (It’s a start!) since my time::: but still females only represent 10% of faculty assigned only to ME (at least per the ME faculty page). When will it be at least 50% or even more? Or maybe the 27% that the article references from two years ago? But then why strive for average?

column1: We are happy to share that Clemson University was once again ranked as one of the top public universities in the country according to the 2022 U.S. News & World Report.  NEWS.CLEMSON.EDU Clemson remains top public university::: leads State of South Carolina in U.S. News rankings · Clemson News
column3: Proud to be part of the #ClemsonFamily! And so very proud my daughter is going to be an alumni as well!!! Go Tigers!!
column4: Yes::: Clemson is dropping in rankings. Remember that US News adjusts its methodology::: and there were significant changes in 2021. It is nearly impossible for Clemson to knock off five or more public universities ahead of them::: especially now. Graduate debt now is a larger factor in rankings::: as is the number of Pell Grant recipients that graduate. Clemson has increased class sizes somewhat::: which was a category where they once shined. Faculty salaries remain a factor. And this year a lot of universities were dinged slightly if they had large numbers of applicants who did not submit SAT/ACT scores (even with that requirement suspended at many schools due to COVID). A wildcard factor is that 20% of a school's ranking is peer reputation. University leaders are asked to rank similar institutions::: whether or not those leaders really know much about the other schools. Bottom line: For Clemson::: USC and other SC public universities to rise in rankings::: the state must fund them at a higher level.
column5: Wow! Go Tigers! Love my school!!!
column6: Proud to be a Tiger!!!
column7: Does anyone know if Clemson is bringing back their swim team?
column8: As an Alumnus::: I would really like to see us back in the top 20! We were ranked 20th when I attended.
column9: In prior years leadership focused on becoming a Top 20 school and made the necessary changes required to chase that goal. We have lowered our expectations dramatically. We have now traded quality for quantity. The obsession with growth numbers at such an accelerated pace has cost us in the rankings. The objective now is to gain as many out of state students as possible because they pay more in tuition. It is a financial decision. That matters more than being an elite smaller school.

How many of y'all have ever played football and if y'all have played how many have played at this level? Our entire team (players::: coaches::: band::: cheerleaders::: etc.) have access to these comments. Is what we are saying helping them or just "piling on"? Answer for yourself. Which way do you want to go? Do you want to inspire these young people? Then think about what you are posting here. Sorry for the rant but I think we need to consider what we post in our comments. column40: From the Clemson Website:  Masks and Face Coverings Following the South Carolina Supreme Court decision which permits higher education institutions to require a universal mask mandate::: Clemson will require masks in all of its statewide buildings including classrooms::: instructional facilities::: offices::: labs::: and residential and dining halls except while eating or in private spaces. The requirement is effective as of Aug. 17 for a period of three weeks.  This three-week period coincides with the greatest risk predicted by our public health team’s modeling of the disease. Masks were shown in our models to a have significant impact on curbing the spread of the virus and correspondingly enhances our ability to stay in person.  The University continues to evaluate all public health data as it mitigates the prevalence of COVID-19 while maximizing opportunities to continue in-person classes.  Physical Distancing All University facilities::: including instructional and research areas::: will operate at full capacity. No physical distancing requirements will be in place at this time.

column1: Effective immediately::: masks will be required in all University facilities statewide for a period of three weeks.  NEWS.CLEMSON.EDU Clemson temporarily requires masks in University facilities at semester start · Clemson News
column3: Yes. As a Clemson nursing grad and Acute Disease Epidemiology Nurse Consultant::: I applaud this news. Additional: Masters in Public Health.
column4: Assuming the goal is in-person classes::: masking and a vaccine mandate are the only way to do it. And it is too late to mandate vaccines. This is a last-minute scramble::: but at least it is a scramble in the right direction.
column5: Pediatrician and Clemson alum: This is how we keep Clemson students safe and this is how we hopefully preserve the football season::: for those most worried about that. I wear a mask all day::: every day. It hasn't diminished my mental capacity yet (that I am aware of). It very definitely has decreased my risk of catching COVID from a patient or family member in my office. It's all part of a layered strategy to minimize the risks of spread- masking::: vaccine::: hand hygiene::: distancing. All of them help but none of them alone will be enough to keep our students safe. We're all in this together. Nothing worth fighting about here. We need to support our students to do the right things to keep themselves and their friends safe and to keep Clemson open for in-person learning.
column6: I am SO thankful this is in place!!! IF we want in person classes::: this was the only way to keep that!! K-12 in Pickens County had so many positive cases and quarantines they have had to go fully virtually (Kershaw Co. is watching/ adjusting in areas)! We DON’T want that!!! Our son is thankful (and so are we) that this has been put in place!!!! 💜💜💜
column7: This is not forever people. Think. It is for 3 weeks! I see Clemson working to keep everyone safe.
column8: I am glad Clemson is doing this::: and frankly am appalled at all the people who are so anti mask. My elementary school child wore a mask all year last year and whined less than the folks I see here. If a simple act like wearing a mask keeps people safe::: keeps your kids in person classes::: then is it such a huge sacrifice? A mask is a heck of a lot easier to wear than a ventilator.
column9: Nurse here…Class of 87. I am reading thru all the whiner comments here and I can assure you that we are tired of wearing masks for a 12 hour shift. We are exhausted from donning PPE every time we go into a Covid room. We are tired of FaceTiming family members right before we intubate your family member. We are tired of watching your loved ones fight only to die. We are tired::: we are sick and tired of your callousness and putting us in harms way. We are sick and tired when you refuse vaccination but end up seeking us for healthcare. So for all that is holy::: get vaccinated. And if you can’t do that::: I’m sure you can tolerate a mask for an hour class. We do it all the time…for you.

column96: I would like to say a few words.  1) I have been a proponent of doing whatever was necessary to get back to an actual normal since the CDC started putting out guidelines shy of wanting mandatory vaccines as that is highly immoral and unethical.  2) I feel sorry that nurses have to deal with the crap that comes with this. Unfortunately you do work in the healthcare industry and that is part of the territory and before I see something about walking a mile in their shoes::: the plant I work in requires a face mask work boots::: safety glasses::: long heavy pants::: and sometimes fire retardant and that’s if you don’t work in paint for twelve hour shifts in barely air conditioned or ventilated floor space while using heavy machinery and performing robust work. I also don’t think someone should go to the doctor let alone ER unless they have conditions or difficulty breathing. And I have lost three grandparents since 2018::: as well as a slew of other close relatives and family friends in my short lifetime so I don’t want to hear how tired you are of watching people die::: I’ve seen too many of my own family die to much more painful and slow diseases.  3) no one should care more about their own health than you. Safety starts with the individual. If you want to catch a bug then so be it as long as you embrace the consequences. If I get the bug from not wearing a mask then I will quarantine and probably won’t even get tested or see a doctor until I am better. Which I am vaccinated. Ultimately with weekly (high false positive) testing I will know quickly if I get it and am not opposed to biweekly testing if that means I don’t have to wear a mask. I wouldn’t be as upset if I hadn’t been lied to because they sure announced a pretty little plan as soon as the SCSC made the ruling (as in hours).  4) if the faculty are doing this on my behalf and self interest::: I sure don’t remember being asked how I felt about it. I don’t remember being asked how I felt my out of state tuition should be used. I don’t remember anyone seeing if it was OK to alter a service from a PUBLIC university and give no assurances if I would even have in person classes the whole semester. I’m in engineering::: do you really want your next airplane signed off by a guy w an online degree who never had actual conversations with engineers and has a minimal grasp on the concepts because grading is easier and learning is harder.  5) let me also say this::: anyone on Clemson’s board who says they care about our health and education is lying. They care about their image and money::: I (we) as a student are just a number to the higher ups next to a dollar sign. If they cared::: they would have shut down the school. If they cared they would have only online at a reduced tuition. If they cared they wouldn’t have the dining halls open. If they cared they would have shut down the buses. If they cared they would have at least hired a company to disinfect each classroom after a class. If they truly cared about our health and well-being they would think about how much more likely depression and suicide has been since all this started. If they cared they would be much more active in reducing student deaths and health issues from underage drinking::: nicotine use::: drug use and other issues that have a higher likely of occurring and of killing than a disease which is less deadly and likely than a car wreck (which I have also been in as a child)
column97: Let’s keep this in perspective. column113: What a disgrace. This is the sorry state of higher education in 2021. No science backs up this mandate. None. In fact::: science dictates no face covering. Sars-CoV 2 is 0.12 microns. column153: It is not surprising to me with the rising trend in COVID cases NATIONWIDE that Clemson is taking the precaution to require masks. column3: I applaud Clemson for returning to full operational status::: but I question the decision to do weekly testing of the entire student population. Students who are fully vaccinated should be exempt from the weekly testing requirement and should only have to test if they are contact traced and have a potential known exposure identified. Full testing of the population is a waste of time and resources. Our son is fully vaccinated and we are sending him to Clemson for the on-campus and in-person education and experience. I have no concerns about the protocols outlined in the "full operational status"::: other than the weekly testing requirement.

column9: This article is misleading!  There has not been any licensing. It EUA and that authorization doesn't include all ages and excludes pregnant women. The phase 3 trials are still ongoing until 2022 and 2023 for Moderna and Pfizer::: respectively.  Yes::: corona virus mRNA has been under development for years.... why was all of the prior formulas animal testing studies not brought to light? Because that is where it keeps failing. It never stopped infection and fails to stop transmission.  Also under development for years is how to deliver that nanotechnology successfully. The coating is made with PEGs. With >70% of our American population with anti-PEG in their system. That places injected PEG in a serious risk zone. Why are you not warning people to make sure they are not PEG sensitive before submitting themselves to this experimental technology?  I have a pre-proof saying financially we need to keep the vaccine-injured under .8% to be cost effective vs just treating the population as needed. So::: they know the jab is going to permanently injure or kill a subset of its users.  Then there is the Pathogenic Priming that was brought to light April 2020 and confirmed in a lab testings in Jan 2021. When you toss a transcriptase in our system there will be errors and mismatches.  I'll be writing to the author using the form in the article as well. This article is propaganda.

column1: Clemson University College of Behavioral::: Social and Health Sciences November 24::: 2020 at 10:00 AM ·  This fall semester was a unique hybrid of online and in-person classes::: as well as rigorous safety policies to reduce the spread of COVID on campus. And with the potential for COVID fatigue as the semester wore on::: this Clemson University Department of Public Health Sciences lecturer had some extra motivation for her students to follow safety precautions.  On the first day back in the classroom this semester::: Tanya Staton told her students that if Clemson was able to hold in-person classes until Thanksgiving break::: they could pie her in the face.  They wore their masks::: social distanced::: used hand sanitizer::: got tested and quarantined when necessary. As the semester went on::: she knew she would have to stay true to her word. And yesterday::: her students had the chance to smash a pie in their teacher's face.
column3: Solid motivation!!

column1: Senior psychology student Catherine Chapman and Harvard University graduate Nicholas Dimitruk are co-founders of Nastro Technologies::: a startup that emerged from a summer internship at the Advanced Functional Fabrics of America::: an Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) technology incubator.  Their flagship product::: currently under development::: is BitRip::: a tape that has a specific pattern that acts like a QR code and unlocks smartphone data such as voice memos::: location and documents. The pair envisions BitRip as a cutting-edge tool that can be used in construction management and delivery tracking.  GO.TIG.RS Data via duct tape: Clemson psychology student launches company featuring tape that allows access to data
column3: I have to admit I went to a much less acclaimed locations of academia after graduating high school the one thing I can say is I was proud of my achievements::: my school::: and those fellow students::: faculty::: and staff that helped my accomplish what I did. However::: in Mr. Swinney's case I would like to vehemently say I feel he has lost touch with the spirit of his university::: he's lost touch with the student athletes::: and general academic population::: who may I say pay a significantly large amount of tuition to attend::: and far more than those who as he often likes to say 'work in the trench's' to actually keep the engine of that wonderful school humming smoothly. Furthermore::: it would appear as of late from the footage I constantly watch on ESPN/LIVE::: Youtube::: Dish Sports::: as well as many other sports viewing Apps. . A man who finds himself judging NCAA commentators whos job it is to question what might be considered subpar performance involving athletes::: coaching::: or strategy/ play-calling. Scoffing at a room full of post-game interviewers::: then asking " Did ya'll watch the same game???::: I'm pretty sure we won!!!::: I don't know which game ya'll were watching::: but I'm pretty sure we handled it!!!"::: and suggesting the 'want to play' is more important::: than the need for these young men::: many of which I might add will be first::: and second round draft picks::: whether they played for you or any other power five school::: and finally and most disgracefully::: insinuating that an opponent felt it necessary to scratch a game from their schedule because they were 'afraid' of risking a loss. I personally believe his behavior::: his attitude::: and moral compass have all been dealt a severe blow in due simply to his seasons of immense success. He no longer embodies the Christian values'::: I once remember him priding himself::: and his team on::: and I am unfortunately he is neither ashamed::: nor phased by any of this truly demeaning language or action. I find no need for the NCAA::: the

column17: Three amazing P O W survivors from W W 2::: Vietnam and Korea!! Colonel Ben Scardon was on his death bed and a fellow Clemson soldier asked if he had anything to trade for a chicken so he cook for him. Col. had only his Clemson ring which he kept hidden from the guards. His CU prisoner boiled it and fed him and he survived!! The story is on You tube I believe! All three men have unbelievable stories to tell!
column18: Three of five of our battalion’s company commanders in Desert Storm (male and female) were Clemson Alumni. I was proud to enter into Clemson University upon retiring from the Army. Clemson has a fine military tradition which brings much credit to South Carolina.

column1: A new era of business education is beginning at Clemson University with a transformational $60 million gift —the largest in University history —from Wilbur O. “Billy” and Ann Powers.  With its signature programs and a new::: best-in-class facility::: the newly named Wilbur O. and Ann Powers College of Business is positioned to equip students with the skills::: knowledge and values to thrive and make an impact in the dynamic global economy.  http://go.tig.rs/znaxay
column3: I think it’s innovative and reflective of a forward looking program that can respect the past while facing forward in a dynamic environment!
column4: The generosity of this family is appreciated! I look forward to our soph tiger benefitting from these facilities as he pursues his finance degree.
column5: Tuition will continue to skyrocket::: student suicide and substance abuse will continue to increase::: football will still be prioritized above all else and Clemson will continue to be catered to the most privileged and the most affluent demographic. This university has changed. While it might look pretty from the outside; the experience as a non-traditional student is honestly embarrassing.  Clemson has never fully supported student veterans::: yet you use us for promotional bits and have a few folks “leading” those veterans that completely lack a spine. Totally afraid to stand up and do the right thing::: or just unwilling to say the difficult things to their superiors and attempt progress. The only thing our university is known for is football. We need to change that before it is too late. Those rings::: trophies and banners might look pretty; but they won’t make 99.9% of the student population (who aren’t going to the NFL) more productive members of society. 🧠 > 💵
column6: Welcome to the WAP College of Business
column7: This is sad...so many of great organizations that could really use this but giving to a college that is already full of money😢

column3: On June 13 I marched with Trevor Lawrence and Darrien Rencher at Clemson in the Black Lives Matter movement. On that day in brief conversation Trevor told me in the hearing of many others He stood with Deshaun Watson and Drew Brees in the the then recent twitter Dustup with Trump over kneeling. As David Wilkins is former Clemson chair and tight with Lindsey Graham the Judiciary hearings have tremendous implications for the character of Clemson and its board of Trustees and football program. To get at the guts of that for all of us here is a comment I just left at the alma maters of Amy Coney Barrett::: St Mary's Dominican in New Orleans and Rhodes College in Memphis!

column1: Clemson University College of Behavioral::: Social and Health Sciences is with Clemson Parks::: Recreation and Tourism Management and 3 others. October 5::: 2020 at 2:00 PM ·  A new tuition support program through Clemson Adaptive Sports will help bring wheelchair tennis student-athletes to Clemson University to play for our Wheelchair Tennis team while earning their degree. The waivers will help grow Clemson’s adaptive sports programs::: increase awareness on campus about adaptive athletics and encourage growth in adaptive sports at the community recreation level::: by giving players a collegiate goal to strive towards. column4: My son's roommate just tested positive at Clemson. They think they got it from Saturday's football game they attended. I went to check the dashboard for the school and it has not been updated in two days!!!! I wrote to the vice president of student affairs and no one responded. At this juncture::: I think Clemson is hiding the fact that the virus is out of control! My son tested negative last week and while he needs to be tested again::: he is presumed positive and prepared to move into the covid hotel/ apartments (assuming they have room for them). There are 510 student occupants already (out of a total population of 23k). How can it be that important to have kids go to the football games? Clemson repeatedly promoted to me that they were going to take all measures to keep these young people safe (so they can take advantage of the financial room and board) and at this point I have absolutely no confidence. Does anyone know anyone high up that can get a straight up answer?? I am very upset.

column1: For more than two years::: #ClemsonUniversity researchers Darren Linvill and Patrick Warren have investigated the tactics of Twitter trolls that spread disinformation and sow discord. Now::: a new virtual space::: the Media Forensics Hub::: will house data::: resources and digital tools for spotting disinformation campaigns.  This venture is designed to not only assist journalists::: policymakers and academics but also to empower everyday users of Facebook::: Twitter::: Instagram and other social media sites in understanding how disinformation works::: how to spot it and how to mitigate its influence.  Read more 👉 go.tig.rs/o6z6iy

column11: I wouldn’t let this bother people as Clemson as well as many other Universities already allow students into the Universities without consideration of SAT/ACT scores. Went military first took a couple college courses during active duty and Clemson never inquired about test scores. Oh and to take courses at Baylor University as an active duty serviceman I was not asked to submit test scores either. This was 1986. Graduated from two universities Engineering and Business degrees without either so don’t sweat it. I went to prep boarding schools and we had classes that specifically taught us how to take the SAT and ACT to maximize our chances of success. Typical for most prep schools. Does every student have that same exposure?

column8: To Whom it may concern at the Clemson University:::  Thank you for your concern for our kids (your students). I know the decision to push back move in couldn’t be easy for you. I do not know the conversations leading up to this decision but I ask you these few questions.  1. Is there another way? 2. Could you find a way to get the students on campus (even with on-line classes). 3. Have you considered the risk of maintaining the fall schedule?  You have said time and again the schedule won’t change. Maybe that is where you should start. Eliminate all special weekends (parents/ family/alumni)::: cancel fall break::: don’t go back after Thanksgiving break. Limit the traveling on and off campus would limit the exposure. I’m most uncomfortable sending my freshman daughter with so many breaks and opportunities for outsiders to be on campus.  Do have each student get tested (rapid testing) upon arrival::: allow the healthy on campus::: make mask wearing manditory(fine first offense::: removal from campus second offense) you’ll have to have strict consequences also require testing while on campus. Have them sign a liability waiver if it’s a legal action you fear.  This is a virus::: I’m not a doctor but all the doctors I’ve spoken to have the same conclusion and that is it’s going nowhere.  I beg you please consider other options::: let those who are healthy and want to get on campus be there. Those who are high risk or not comfortable can remote learn. Keep classes online if you need but please let those who want on campus.  Thank you in advance for your consideration.

column60: Laws basically are made to protect us from each other. You get that? Laws are made to protect me from you and you from me. But I don’t need those laws if I love you. What is missing in the human heart is this kind of love. There’s no love for God::: there’s no love for others that satisfies God. So in light of this reality::: we are to love. We are to love God so that we obey His word; and His word says::: “We are to love others as ourselves. We are to do no injustice::: take no vengeance::: do no harm to anyone ever.”  So as a Christian::: I’m looking at the world today and I’m watching all kinds of things going on with regard to injustices and suffering. There’s no question about it::: there’s lots of injustice in the world. It’s everywhere. Nobody has a corner on it and no group of people have a corner on it. So what are my options in the current situation? Let me be specific and give you some that have been suggested.  First of all::: one option would be to join Black Lives Matter::: join their cause::: because::: after all::: Black lives do matter; of course::: they do – created in the image of God. And those who have suffered deserve our support::: and they do; and they have suffered injustice::: and they have. So should we just join Black Lives Matter to affirm these things? “Can we join out of sympathy? Can we join out of compassion?” That’s not really the question. The question is::: “Can we join::: and in joining express love to God?” because whatever we do for our neighbor is subsumed under loving God with all our heart::: soul::: and mind. “Can I join Black Lives Matter? Can I be a part::: if not a member; can I be a part of their function?” They are disruptive. They are rebellious. They are radical. They are anti-authority. They are Marxists. They are atheistic.  What are their guiding principles? Let me read them to you. In their own document we read this: “Black Lives Matter is transgender-aff irming. We make space for transgender siblings. We do the work required to dismantle cisgender” – which mean biological sex – “and uplift transgender Black folk::: especially transgender Black women who continue to be disproportionat ely impacted by trans antagonistic violence.” They are transgender-aff irming. According to Deuteronomy 22:5::: transgender behavior is an abomination to God.  Also::: this is their declaration: “We are womanists rather than feminists.” Quote: “We build a space that affirms Black women and is free from sexism::: misogyny::: and environments where men are centered.” End quote. Transgender-aff irming and wanting to pull down the leadership of men. According to the Word of God::: man is the head of the woman::: as God is the head of Christ. The man has the responsibility of leadership. That’s an anti-God idea. Another paragraph – and there are many more: “We are queer-affirming . We gather to free ourselves from the tight grip of the belief that all are heterosexual.” They gather to put an end to the notion that everybody needs to be heterosexual.  In he same book of Leviticus::: where the Lord says::: “I am the Lord; be holy:::” chapter 18::: verse 22 say::: “You shall not lie with a male as one lies with a female; it is an abomination. In the next verse it says it’s the same as having intercourse with an animal. Chapter 20 of Leviticus::: verse 13::: exactly the same thing. Romans chapter 1.  Here’s a quote from Black Lives Matter: “We are intentionally amplifying that the particular experience of violence that Black queer transgender::: gender nonconforming women and intersex people face::: there can be no liberation for the Black people if we do not fight for these people.” This is an organization designed by Satan to use the suffering of some people as the means to destroy their lives::: to destroy morality::: conscience::: the family::: and even the church::: and replace it with behavior that is immoral::: perverse::: abominable::: soul-destroying ::: family-destroyi ng::: marriage-killin g::: and culturally disastrous. Bottom line: those documents are anti-God::: anti-Scripture::: anti-Christ. This is an organization that is the enemy of God. Do you really believe that going down that path is going to do anything to lift up a culture? It has nothing to do with the color of anybody’s skin. Go down that path and it’s the path of absolute total destruction. Wipe out the law of God in the heart::: give people immorality as a standard::: destroy the family::: take the message of the gospel out of the church::: and the only possible restraint left is the police to try to stop the flood.

column15: My father graduated after World War ll::: I am an alum::: my husband::: children::: sister::: and nieces and nephews. I an proud of this decision. Thank you Board of Trustees!
column16: Such a shame. We cannot erase our history.  Stop trying to re-write our history. Learn from it instead.  Realize that all great men/women who made wonderful contributions to our college and our community::: were not perfect and didn't always do the right things in all facets of their lives. Do any of us?  These historical buildings/ markers/statues do not signify EXISTING cultural views::: they signify our past::: OUR HISTORY. The good::: bad and ugly of our history.  If we forget our history we are bound to repeat it.  To cite Orwell ‘he who controls the past::: controls the future’ is too often read as a manual for action rather than a warning against authoritarianis m.  Shame on you Clemson University! You have done a disservice to our college::: our towns and to history itself.
column17: This is absurd. Changing the names on buildings doesn't change the past. We have obviously moved on and grown from the past::: but is ridiculous to try and erase it. column28: I could not care less about Tillman being changed; he was an important figure in the establishment of the University. His stance on race was common during his time and his outspokenness on the subject isn't positive...but his treatment of anybody who didn't align with his political motives wasn't all that nice::: either. HOWEVER::: I draw the line at the removal of Calhoun from anything. JCC served our state and country in many::: many honorable roles. The lion share of the US's founding fathers were part of the mindset and society of the time. If we're going to cave to this::: we should "start over" as a country and rename EVERTHING that has any tie to anyone who isn't of today's values; i.e.::: buildings::: towns::: counties::: states::: country and yes::: even our continent (Amerigo Vespucci did own slaves). Furthermore::: the land which was eventually GIVEN to the state is what the core of the university sits upon. We cannot change history nor can we change the mindset of times past. Clemson University has not excluded anyone in recent times; women and people of color were all excluded::: but not anymore. Clemson University embraces the educational development of ALL people regardless of any "differences" they may possess. Stop with all this knee-jerk reactions. Stop trying to make-up for past transgressions. ..no matter what gets "changed:::" the past will always be just that; the past!
column29: Clemson has always been a remarkable place for enlightenment ! Thank you for this thoughtful and courageous step forward.
column30: As a Clemson alum::: I'm fine with this. It removes two big distractions and makes minority students feel more welcome.  A wise decision.

column53: The problem with this is it won't end here.  Thomas Green Clemson served as a miner in the confederate army and it's documented he did this unwillingly as they held his land hostage. His son was also conscripted and spent nearly the entirety of the war in a Union prison. If you read the will of Thomas Green Clemson::: and I have::: it is purposely ambiguous and has no mention of race or sex. Dr. Jerry Reel discusses this at great length in his History 100 "History of Clemson" class.  Clemson was essentially created as an agricultural "experiment station" under the Morrill Land grant act to help rebuild the war torn south. column97: Gospel Jn 19:25-34  Standing by the cross of Jesus were his mother and his mother’s sister::: Mary the wife of Clopas::: and Mary of Magdala. When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple there whom he loved::: he said to his mother::: “Woman::: behold::: your son.” Then he said to the disciple::: “Behold::: your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his home. After this::: aware that everything was now finished::: in order that the Scripture might be fulfilled::: Jesus said::: “I thirst.” There was a vessel filled with common wine. So they put a sponge soaked in wine on a sprig of hyssop and put it up to his mouth. When Jesus had taken the wine::: he said::: “It is finished.” And bowing his head::: he handed over the spirit.  Now since it was preparation day::: in order that the bodies might not remain on the cross on the sabbath::: for the sabbath day of that week was a solemn one::: the Jews asked Pilate that their legs be broken and they be taken down. So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and then of the other one who was crucified with Jesus. But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead::: they did not break his legs::: but one soldier thrust his lance into his side::: and immediately Blood and water flowed out.

column1: The Class of 1967 Endowment for Veterans Resources was established in honor of their 50th Anniversary with a pledge of $100:::000. The endowment budget will provide operational support for our Clemson Student Veteran Center.  To date::: this class has raised more than $60:::000. One class member has committed to match::: dollar for dollar::: any gift donated to reach the $100:::000 goal before the deadline of July 2020.  Click here to learn how you can help support our Student Veteran Center here at Clemson ➡️ bit.ly/3ctrhoJ

column1: 🧡 These Tigers brought our students to the finish line of their academic year during a time of unprecedented change.  And in the weeks and months that follow::: their deeds will power our journey forward::: toward brighter days when we can all be together again. Read their stories here ⤵️  NEWSSTAND.CLEMSON.EDU How the Clemson Family went above and beyond to respond to COVID-19
column3: My favorite part of your response was when we were still going to class and every day we would get an email saying how everything was fine and nobody had coronavirus. My second favorite part was when you sent us home for spring break without knowledge of whether the rest of the semester would be online. If I had to describe Clemson’s response to virus with one word it would be Opaque.
